Line: Written by Gregg Kavet & Andy Robin

I always feel bad for the silver medal winner in the Olympics. How do you live with that the rest of your life? People are gonna keep asking - How much did you lose by? I don't even know...! It was like... now.now...now.now..now..was like, like... now..now..now...! It was it...! Eh, it was it and I lost. I trained, I worked out, I exercised, I did everything, I was doing push-ups, sit-ups, I never did anything but exercise and work out for 20 years, I flew half way around the world and aaaaaaaaaah!... And that was...it was a photo-finish! Silver......gold. If I had a pimple, I would've won.
I can't believe you write for this J. Peterman catalog.
Get this one - "I packed my rod and reel. 30 hours later, lost in the fiord, a welcoming smile. Thank god she spotted the epaulettes on my Norwegian ice-fishing vest".
This catalog is all about how to score in a foreign country.
Yeah. What do you do all day?
Not that much.
uh-uh.

Yeah, when the season starts. Right now, I sit around pretending that I'm busy.
How do you pull that off?
I always look annoyed. Yeah, when you look annoyed all the time, people think that you're busy. Think about it... .
Yeah, you do! He looks very busy!
Yeah, he looks busy! Yeah!

Yeah, that's him.

I mean, it's like the biggest event of your life! You'd think you'd have, like, 6 alarm

What responsibility? I don't have any responsibility.

Fine.

My money's on the snooze. I bet he hit the snooze for an extra 5 and it never came back
Alarm clocks? I never use 'em. Don't trust 'em.
What do you do?
I have a uh...mental alarm. I set my head for... quarter to seven and...
Always works?
It never fails. See, it's based on your body clock. See, your body has an internal
uh-uh. What's with the bucket?
Lomez, he sold me his hot tub.

You put a hot tub... in your living room?
Oh, it's a beauty! It's got these high-volume aqua-sage jets oscillating and pulsating,
Is that tolerable?
Oh...it's tolerable...!
Isn't that the same temperature the coffee that scalded you?
Oh, I think it's a little cooler than that...

I don't ask those kind of questions anymore.

Nice to meet you.

Man, it wasn't the snooze. Most people think it was the snooze, but no, no snooze.
Man, it wasn't the AM/PM. It was the volume.
Ah...the volume.
Yes, the volume. There was a separate knob for the radio alarm.
Ah, separate knob.

Jerry...

uh-uh. uh-uh. And this all means uh...what?

I know, but it's a very important wake-up call... and I don't wanna take any chances.

Well, I just...don't wanna get into a whole thing with you here...

...Yeah I am, but I just...
humm...
